author: .fjl
content: I also want to echo the sentiment from Matt. We have designed the requests mechanism so that it can be extended very easily on the EL side. It just requires adding a contract address to call during block processing. All the real complexity is in the contract.

author: .fjl
content: I originally wanted to emit the request type byte from the contract as well, and I also wanted to allow emitting requests in arbitrary order. These two things would've allowed us to build a flexible and generic EL->CL messaging contract. But the idea to make it so flexible was overruled in discussions, and the system we have now is very much tied to one contract per request type.

author: .fjl
content: It makes no sense to redesign this now, we will be able to realize any kind of request with the system we have, just need to define the contract for it and add it into the EL.

author: potuz
content: Alright, I give up, I wanted to save some time and coordination, even though I don't understand the above arguments, I'll probably be asking soon to add a new request type then
